descricao:
About The Role

Job Title   Quality Manager 

Location   Remote within Portugal 

Terms        Permanent Contract / Full-Time 40h weekly 

Schedule   Business Hours 

 

To thrive in this role, you’ll bring a strong blend of technical expertise, leadership, and a passion for continuous improvement. You are proactive, data-driven, and collaborative, with a deep understanding of quality assurance in a fast-paced environment. 

  • Analytical Mindset: You approach problems with logic and data. You’re skilled at interpreting complex datasets, identifying trends, and extracting actionable insights. You use evidence to inform decisions and continuously seek ways to improve processes through data-driven strategies.
  • Excellent Communication Skills: You can clearly articulate quality standards, expectations, and feedback to diverse audiences—from frontline agents to senior leadership and clients. You’re confident in presenting findings, facilitating discussions, and driving alignment across teams.
  • Detail-Oriented: You have a sharp eye for inconsistencies and errors, and you take pride in maintaining high standards. Whether reviewing audit results or refining SOPs, you ensure accuracy and completeness in everything you do.
  • Strategic Thinking with a Hands-On Approach: You see the bigger picture and understand how quality impacts business outcomes. While you can design long-term strategies, you’re also comfortable rolling up your sleeves to implement solutions, troubleshoot issues, and support teams directly.
  • Collaborative and Influential: You build strong relationships across departments and geographies. You’re able to influence without authority, foster alignment, and drive change through partnership and shared goals.
  • Self-Motivated and Independent: You thrive in a remote work environment, managing your time effectively and staying focused without direct supervision. You take initiative, follow through on commitments, and proactively seek out opportunities to add value.
  • Tech-Savvy and Innovation-Driven: You embrace technology as a tool for transformation. You’re comfortable working with AI, automation platforms, and quality monitoring tools, and you actively explore new solutions to enhance efficiency and scalability.
  • Customer-Centric Mindset: You understand that quality is not just about internal standards—it’s about delivering exceptional experiences to clients and end-users. You advocate for the customer in every decision and ensure that quality practices reflect their needs and expectations.

 

Your profile

  • 3+ years of experience in quality assurance or operations management, preferably within the BPO or customer service industry.
  • Proven track record of implementing AI/automation in quality processes.
  • Experience in leading cross-functional teams and managing quality programs across multiple clients.
  • Strong background in performance coaching, training, and stakeholder engagement.

 

Why us? 

  • Fully Remote work based in Portugal
  • A competitive salary 
  • Flexible benefits
  • Equipment provided
  • Home office allowance 
  • Online Gym and Wellbeing Studio
  • The opportunity for professional growth
  • Fun company events and team outings
  • Autonomy and Responsibility 

 

Send your CV in English to: sara.pratas@otonomee.com

Your connection with Aubay starts with the following lines:

 

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, present in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Porto and are specialized consultants in Management, Implementation, Development, and Maintenance of Information Systems. We operate across various sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy, and transportation, with more than 150 active partners.

What we are looking for

  • 4 to 6+ years of experience in front-end development, QA, UX, or digital project management
  • Experience coordinating technical and business teams, ensuring the delivery of high-quality audits and reports
  • Experience translating technical results into clear, actionable recommendations for product teams
  • Ability to lead and support a small team (2–3 people) in their day-to-day work

IAAP certification (CPACC, WAS, or ADS) will be valued

  • Capacity to act as the main point of contact with the client, ensuring alignment between needs and deliverables
  • Knowledge of digital accessibility standards (WCAG 2.2, RGAA) and assistive technologies is a plus
  • Experience working in Agile environments (Scrum) and engaging with multiple stakeholders
  • Strong organizational and prioritization skills, with a proactive and structured mindset
  • Ability to plan, prioritize, and monitor accessibility audit activities
  • Excellent communication skills, written and spoken, in French and English – minimum B2

What we offer you

  • Health insurance
  • Career development with regular feedback and continuous learning opportunities
  • Hybrid working model in Porto
  • Access to the Aubay Learning Academy for technical and soft skills growth
  • Dynamic and collaborative environment with national and international projects
  • Team events and company gatherings

 

What makes us different?

  • Transparent communication and supportive team spirit
  • Recognition awards and birthday gifts
  • No dress code – be yourself
  • A friendly work culture where everyone knows your name
  • You’ll grow in good company — isn’t that the best way to evolve professionally?

 

If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first step?

We’re waiting for you at maria.t.moreno@aubay.pt

Personal Data collected by AUBAY PORTUGAL as Data Controller, regarding the identification, contact and professional capabilities of the candidates, in the present procedure, will be processed for the application analysis, having in consideration that the processing is conducted in order to to take the steps, at the request of the data subject, prior to entering into a contract; 

Personal data sent through the present application will be kept by Aubay during the application procedure and will remain stored whilst updated (for two years period). 

The collected data might be transferred or include other processing activities, as long as the data subject is informed, in the occurrence of a standard application and selection procedure, for the compliance of legal obligations for the time required by law. 

For any queries or request regarding personal data protection rights, the Data Subject may contact AUBAY PORTUGAL’s headquarters in Avenida Duque D`Ávila, nº46 em Lisboa or use the DPO’s e-mail - dpo@aubay.pt. The Data Subject also has the right to file a complaint with the National Data Protection Authority – www.cnpd.pt. 

(please do not include data regarding racial or ethnical origins, political opinions, religion, philosophy, biometrical data, health data, sexual life and orientation, or relating to criminal convictions and offences.)

A Noesis procura um recurso para reforçar a equipa de Gestão Acessos e Segurança, com o objetivo de ser o Interface do IT para o SOC do cliente, definir politicas de segurança de informação da empresa e identificar e resolver fragilidades de segurança no ecossistema aplicacional do cliente.

Requisitos:

  • Elevada capacidade para definir e estruturar a Politica de Segurança de Informação;
  • Capacidade para definir e implementar políticas de recolha, armazenamento e tratamento de logs em ambientes aplicacionais complexos;
  • Competência para definir a política e acompanhar a sua execução, associadas a um serviço de Security Operations Center – SOC em SIEM IBM-QRADAR;
  • Experiencia na gestão de ferramentas de UBA- User Behavior Analysis e NBA – Network Behavior Analysis;
  • Conhecimento de gestão de ferramentas de MDM e Endpoint Security (ex: Crowdstrike, TrendMicro);
  • Conhecimentos da norma ISO 27001;
  • Capacidade para definir um modelo de gestão de acessos assente em perfis funcionais baseado numa politica de role based access control – RBAC;
  • Experiência na gestão de vulnerabilidades;
  • Conhecimento dos processos de desenvolvimento aplicacional de CI/CD.
     

Regime de Trabalho: híbrido (3x por semana no escritório)

 

Se reúnes estas condições e gostarias de integrar uma organização inovadora, que aposta continuamente na formação dos seus talentos, envia-nos a tua candidatura aqui > IT Security Consultant 

Join us. Let’s innovate together!

Todos os nossos processos de recrutamento e seleção baseiam-se na igualdade de oportunidades, valorizando a competência e o potencial de cada pessoa e garantindo que nenhum candidato ou candidata é discriminado com base em género, etnia, orientação sexual, idade, religião ou condição física.
